H0.text: The elements on the right side of the periodic table are solid at room temperature, distinguishing them from the elements on the left side.

H1.text: Elements on the right side of the periodic table are good electrical conductors, distinguishing them from the elements on the left side.

H2.text: Generally have very high densities is a property that distinguishes elements on the right side of the periodic table from those on the left.

H3.text: Tend to form ions by gaining electrons is the characteristic that distinguishes elements on the right side of the periodic table from those on the left side.

A6.text: Nonmetals will gain electrons to form negatively charged ions.
